intro: Silene tetragyna, commonly known as the four-angled catchfly, is a flowering plant native to parts of Europe and western Asia. It is a member of the Caryophyllaceae family, characterized by its showy, pink or white flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky slopes. Its stems are square in cross-section, a feature shared by many species in the genus Silene. Silene tetragyna produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain numerous seeds, which are dispersed by wind.
